website_summaries.verdict: A nice price for a sturdy cooler, but you'll need to make sure you plug it in for 4-5 hours before you wish to use it.
pros: Ergonomic design features a curved back that comfortably hugs your side while carrying
Comes with a long power cord
Can be plugged into a car cigarette lighter as well
cons: Will drain your battery if you leave it going in a car that is not running
Takes a few hours to pre-cool

customer_reviews.title: Works well, lasted 4 years
customer_reviews.text: Just bought my second one. Bought first one for cross country trip 4 years ago. Worked great. Used frequently since, but it finally gave out 6 months ago. Used it frequently; we travel a lot. After it gave out, I used a conventional cooler for a couple months, but realized how convenient and effective the thermoelectric cooler was. Looked at other units but determined that this was the best available in terms of effectiveness and cost, so I bought another one last month. Would rate it 5 stars if my original unit had lasted longer.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Poor cooling efficiency and high power consumption
customer_reviews.text: Poor cooling efficiency and high power consumption, plug in more than 1 hours during the summer time the cooler still warn, the cigarette socket is very hot due to the high power consumption, battery running out from 12v to 11v within a hour, the noisy fan is very annoy. It is better use the regular cooler which is much cheaper than "less ice" . To buy this item means you still need to prepare a lot of ice, don't waste your $ to buy an useless item.
customer_reviews.author: T. CHEN

customer_reviews.title: This cooler made our long road trip a lot more pleasant!
customer_reviews.text: We recently went on a long road trip, and purchased this cooler so we could have our refrigerated foods close at hand and not have to worry about buying ice and draining it after the ice melted. This cooler worked perfectly, both in our hotel rooms and in the car, keeping our food and drinks cold and refreshing. When traveling, it was on the floor behind the driver's seat, and the noise of the fan running was audible, but barely. It runs very quietly, and keeps its contents consistently cold. Well worth the money, and my wife and I are very pleased with its performance.
customer_reviews.author: Jake S.

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: We took this cooler on a multi day road trip.It certainly keeps cold items cool and fresh. Dont expect it to cool room temperature items quickly. If you are going to have it unplugged or the vehicle shut off, it will no longer keep your items cold. You can always add ice packs. Its roomy and will fit more than just a six pack of drinks. Its exactly how they advertised it and what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: AE

customer_reviews.title: Buyer be ware!
customer_reviews.text: Did not even plug in the unit to see if it worked because the lid won't stay attached to the chest, it keeps falling off when I open it. This unit is junk and going back to Amazon. I see that the Igloo box says made in America. Boy, am I disappointed. Another point, the unit was packed in it's factory box upside down. Seem Igloo has some real quality control problems.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Nice cooling option
customer_reviews.text: We were traveling where there was no promise of refrigeration with a medication that lost efficacy when warm. It worked very well at keeping the temperature overnight when plugged in. We put some already chilled sodas in one day and checked periodically and they stayed chilled.s. We did not attempt to cool anything warm, just maintain temperature. It worked wonderfully and our meds stayed cool. Maryanne
customer_reviews.author: Joe Rich

customer_reviews.title: Just bad cords I hope.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 26qt cooler June 1, 2016. Since the AC adapter didn't come with it, I purchased the Wagan AC adapter. Because there was not an Igloo adaptor available at the time. Everything worked great for several uses in brand a new Jeep Cherokee. Then no power through the AC plug or the AC adaptor. Checker the fuse, melted ends and all 3 plug in Jeep. Tried my sons cooler in Jeep it works, tried his cord with the Igloo it works. So I am going to try buy-in a new Igloo DC plug and Igloo AC adaptor. Hope this works the AC adaptor is expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Hendrickson

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler
customer_reviews.text: We bought this cooler to transport my husband’s insulin when we moved. It was a life saver. It kept the insulin cool in the car, and in our hotels at night with the adapter. The handle made it easy to carry. If you are traveling and need to keep anything cool, this id perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler!
customer_reviews.text: We love this cooler. The storage capacity in the description was accurate. It doesn’t hold a ton, but it’s perfect for a weekend camping trip or a long road trip. It’s also nice to have in the car when you don’t necessarily want to have to go straight home from the grocery store because you don’t have to worry about your cold foods getting warm.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Handle sucks dont buy
customer_reviews.text: Handle broke after a week... 3 bottles of water, 2 bottles small bottles of soda and a pack of beef jerky... is all I had in it
customer_reviews.author: Destiny

customer_reviews.title: Completely useless
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is less than a year old and was only used 5 or 6 times. It’s broken, will no longer cool food. I think that it should last at least a year at this price point. Trying to see if there is any type of warranty . I do not recommend and suggest trying another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Momma2boyz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for traveling and keeps things colder than our fridge.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing ever. My boyfriend is a truck driver and keeps it in his truck. No need to worry about ice and it keeps everything very cold. The only problem we had was the cord wouldn’t stay plugged in. We contacted amazon and it was quickly replaced and not works wonderfully. I highly recommend Todd product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Lee

customer_reviews.title: Power cord fell apart after only using for one week ...
customer_reviews.text: Power cord fell apart after only using for one week. I'll contact the manufacturer and see if they'll offer to replace it, and then maybe I'll change my rating.
customer_reviews.author: T. J. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Igloo Iceless Thermoelectric Cooler
customer_reviews.text: Sorry to say but this quit working after one road trip from Upstate New York down to Florida. 5 days down and it worked and about 2 days on the way back it quit and hasn't worked since. And there doesn't appear a way to open it up and troubleshoot what the problem is. Fan turns but it doesn't cool.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Just keep in mind that you can't fill it all the way to top like you would with a normal cooler
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife, who drives around town for work, and she loves it. Keeps her lunch cold during the day so she doesn't have to make a special trip to the office or to home. Also worked perfectly for Thanksgiving for traveling to family. Just keep in mind that you can't fill it all the way to top like you would with a normal cooler. The motor does stick down into the cooler about 1 1/2".
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Very, very happy with this cooler!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be more pleased with the performance of this cooler! We needed it to keep our meat from the freezer chilled while we moved across country. We used the Wagan 5 Amp AC to 12V DC Power Adapter so that we could "pre-chill" the cooler for three hours before adding our food (per instructions). I would have been happy for the meat to stay cold enough for safety, but after four days on the road (using the AC adapter at night in the hotels), our meat was still frozen when we got to our new house!
customer_reviews.author: C. Elam

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: This item us surprisingly utilitarian. It fits nicely behind the driver's seat in my crew cab pickup. I am diabetic and use it to store my insulin on long trips. It also works well connected to a 120v ac outlet when staying over at a motel. The size is just right. It's internal cavity is large and well proportioned to take even a half gallon container. As for durability? I have only had the cooler for about four months, so the jury is still out on how long it will last. But, it gets some fairly rough use, and still keeps on cooling. Only mark against it? it does not come with 120v ac adapter.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lemert Whitmer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for road trips of any kind...
customer_reviews.text: This cooler works well. I purchased it as a gift for my brother in law who is a long haul trucker. He loves the fact that he can load it up and everything stays nice and cool without having to refreeze the annoying cooler packs or having to buy ice every time he stops. My sister also likes it because she can fill it with cold foods and go camping with it. They purchased a small adapter that can plug into an outlet for the generator. She has a port in the back of her SUV so it makes it great for road trips no matter what!
customer_reviews.author: LisaStarLeo

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have purchased the bigger one. I was afraid it would be too big, but it's not nearly as large as I expected. We took this on our summer 2015 trip to Colorado and back, and it worked great. Kept everything cold and no mess of water from frozen ice. Works like a fridge. We transferred it from the car to hotel (using a separately purchased plug) and it worked great for the 3 day trip there and then the 3 day trip back. We also use this on our short road trips to the coast. Keep everything perfectly cold until we get it to the fridge in the cabin.
customer_reviews.author: Charmaine Jay

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for center seat
customer_reviews.text: Took it out on a 3200 mile round trip. Put it in the center seat between two car seats. Kept the kids from fighting and our drinks/food cold. The noise of the fan isn't noticed once you are underway. The kid is a little heavy, so little fingers can get hurt (ask me how I know). I do recommend plugging it in the night before to get things cold. Get the inverter plug also. It will save you in hotels that don't have fridges.
customer_reviews.author: Joe L.

customer_reviews.title: Best 75 bucks I've spent
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this electric cooler for storing breastmilk during traveling. I followed the suggested instructions as far as pre cooling the unit by plugging it into the wall the night before (wall plug sold separately) and then packing 2 quart size zipper bags with ice. After 10 hours the ice I had put into the cooler to help with the cool down process barely melted. I am very impressed at the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Specgirl80

customer_reviews.title: Leave the ice chest home.
customer_reviews.text: Used this initially on a cross-country trip (Virginia/Colorado/Oklahoma/Virginia) with our Vanagon. Much, much better than an ice chest. You don't have to deal with re-charging with ice, draining water, and wringing out the punctured package that you didn't see on the bottom which filled with water. We used the van's 12v when we were traveling, and 120v (via a home made converter) when we were camped. Note - don't place it where someone might press on the lid when moving around - the lid will hit the running fan, making an unhappy noise.
customer_reviews.author: J. Menard

customer_reviews.title: This cooler is great! From picnics at the lake to road trips
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is great! From picnics at the lake to road trips, this thing will keep stuff cool. I leave it plugged into my Ram 1500 overnight with no starting (battery) issues the following day all the time. It is very quiet (unless you accidentally push down on the lid where it will rub the running fan). There is an impressive amount of space in the cooler and it is not much heavier than a standard cooler (lighter and more space when you consider that you don't need all that ice to keep it cool).
customer_reviews.author: D. Chestnut

customer_reviews.title: Best 12v cooler
customer_reviews.text: I drive a truck long haul. This works great for cold drinks. After 2 days in 97 degree heat I came back to work, plugged in the cooler and 8 hours later I had cold drinks. It holds a case of cola easily with room for other food items. I'd definitely recommend and buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick S.

customer_reviews.title: Great  for OTR Driver
customer_reviews.text: Fits about 6 bottles and about 4 containers pefectly. Keeps everything really cold. If the AC is blowing on it things can even get icy. Plug gets really got and if the top gets pushed down it touches the fan
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Very handy little cooler
customer_reviews.text: This is a very handy little cooler. That does an excellent job of keeping your stuff cool. It's also small enough it and has a handle on it makes it very easy to carry. Make absolutely sure your cigarette plug is in good shape because it does draw right much current. I think I'm gonna add an extra electrical plug just for the cooler and so it'll keep running when I turn off the car. I know if I leave it running it'll kill the battery but it should run okay for a while without any problems. I'm very pleased with it
customer_reviews.author: nuts 510

customer_reviews.title: Love this cooler.
customer_reviews.text: I love this cooler!!! It is my second one... I travel for a living and brought my last one EVERYWHERE... even put it in my checked luggage for 2 years until it died. I used it like a fridge and it was awesome. Just bought this one to replace and it seems like they made some improvements and changes and so far so good. It works great!
customer_reviews.author: Brendyn

customer_reviews.title: Great for car and great for motels!
customer_reviews.text: I have always had an ice chest and dealt with the ice issue. It is amazing to cool it off in advance, plug it in to a cigarette lighter thing in the car, and unload it first at a motel, so I can attach it to the adapter and have a 'fridge' in my room! The temperature is excellent for milk for cereal as well as ice cold beer and everything else in between!
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine Wait

customer_reviews.title: Got the job done
customer_reviews.text: This cooler saved us when our refrigerator died. We were able to keep perishables in it until the new fridge was delivered a couple of weeks later. It kept everything nice and cold. It's quiet, too, just a soft whirring. The cooler doesn't get warm on the outside at all, but the transformer does, so be careful where you put the transformer. The capacity is pretty good; this is not a huge cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Chef Leo

customer_reviews.title: Great little  cooler  and made in the U.S.
customer_reviews.text: Great cooler, however somewhat top heavy since the cooling mechanism is on the top ( need to strap it down so it won't tip over when driving). Also be careful not to lift handle from back when plugged in as it can damage the cord where it plugs into the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Ron P

customer_reviews.title: Keeps it cold without ice.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely an ice box. Great works well. Suggestion: place fruit n like perishables in a freezer bag for better results
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for - Convenience & Lightweight !!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cooler of a 4 day weekend excursion - worked perfectly - it kept all items cold in my car - I purchased the converter also and it worked perfectly as well. Filled - it wasn't too heavy for me to carry. In and out of the car with ease. I'm so pleased with my purchase. Just remember to cool it down prior to filling - the manufacturer recommends it. Looking forward to my weekend excursion !!!
customer_reviews.author: Monica Van Leeuwen

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two of these coolers. One we gave to our daughter and the other to our son. They both own Jeeps. They have used the coolers and report that they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Trade Wind Products

customer_reviews.title: Becareful about plug
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't hold very much..but cools of great.only thing is cord already broke to plug into lighter part so becareful about that.im looking for a replacement now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cooler
customer_reviews.text: Awesome cooler, it really works quite well. At room temp (about 70 degrees) it keeps food really cold - not just cool. I haven't tested it during a heat wave so no comments on how it works during extreme heat but at normal temps this thing is amazing, so glad I bought it. Runs quiet enough just the sound of the fan circulating the air.
customer_reviews.author: Mister_TTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Broken power cord
customer_reviews.text: The cooler is great, works like it should. Problem I had with it is the power cord. First it was blowing fuses, second, the cigarette adapter melted down on me and I had to replace it. Good thing I noticed it or I would have lost about 50$ worth of food. This needs to be fixed by company. Needs to have a heavier duty adapter on it. I will not buy again because of the plug issue.
customer_reviews.author: merrill

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our SUV! Very easy to clean and we absolutely love it. Can’t think of a road trip without this!
customer_reviews.author: PSingh

customer_reviews.title: Nice Idea, uses about 50 watts of power.
customer_reviews.text: It could run off of a 12vdc 50+ watt solar panel, if you were camping. I bought a 12VDC 5 amp charger to run indoors. Uses solid state cooling, no compressor, however it does have a small fan to move air over the heat exchanger. You can hear it run in a quiet room, but its not loud enough to bother you in a car. eliminates the need for Ice, but wont make ice, keep items in low 40's
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Very secure, keeps things cold, nice long cable. Great packaging, no issues or complaints. We love it
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: 20 days straight use so far
customer_reviews.text: We are on a road trip and have used.this 20 days straight and so far it has been excellent. Runs in air conditioned car and hotel room but sits for hours in various parking areas and still kept food cold. We add a cool pack that has been chilling in room fridge freezer most days. Things do gather moisture in the south east unlike the southwest where we never see condensation in the cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado gal

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Stays in my vehicle. Always plugged in and always stocked up. Big enough to fit a lot of drinks or food but small enough so it doesnt take up too much space in the car. Love it. Also Great for long road trips.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Necessary for any road trip, no more messy Ice!
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect and most necessary purchase we made for our summer road trip and vacation this year. We had a 10 month old baby girl with us, so it was important to keep her food and milk cold, along with any other refrigerated road snacks! This cooler fit perfectly behind the seat and was easy to access while on the road. It was very quite while running and kept everything very cold. The only thing that was an inconvenience was that we couldn't place anything on top of the cooler as it would effect the fan, but that didn't change our opinion on how much we loved this cooler!
customer_reviews.author: Joy Lampl

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy Cooler
customer_reviews.text: Very handy cooler to have. Works well once it is cold, which takes a couple of hours, so you have to plug it in before use. It works better if you have a couple of ice packs in with your items. Only thing I wish had come with it was an AC adapter. I had one already that I used to run it in my hotel room(Holiday Inn Express). I will definitely use it again on my next trip.
customer_reviews.author: W. Pickert

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling
customer_reviews.text: Took it to Pennsylvania, Maryland and Washington DC. Being on a special diet, I need to carry my own food. I drive a Fiat Pop so packing space is important the cooler is small enough to fit easily into the car, because it doesn't need ice there is plenty of room for the food. On a two week trip it was a real life saver.
customer_reviews.author: James C. Gregory Jr.

customer_reviews.title: ... WOULD OF SEEN THE 2 QUART LARGER UNIT FOR LIKE $15. 00 MORE
customer_reviews.text: WISH I WOULD OF SEEN THE 2 QUART LARGER UNIT FOR LIKE $15.00 MORE....OH WELL. I HOOKED IT UP IN THE HOUSE WITH THE INVERTER OPTION. I PUT IN SOME PRE CHILLED SODAS AND LET HER RUN FOR 36 HOURS. THE DRINKS WERE AS COLD AS THE FRIDGE DRINKS ARE. I HAVE NOT USED IT YET BUT ARE GOING ON THE ROAD FOR A WEEK IN HOT WEATHER.., INSIDE A VEHICLE ALTHOUGH IT WAS 90 IN THE HOUSE......MORE TO COME.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Brown

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Cooler
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is excellent. We always plug it in the night before with a few ice packs in it to boost the cool. Purchased a DC adapter and we take this in the car wherever we go. Keeps drinks very cold for the length of the trip. Took it from Maine to Niagara Falls Canada, making 1 hour rest stops in between where the unit would turn off due to no power in the car. The cooler kept everything perfect, even with the hour breaks. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Poppins Fan

customer_reviews.title: Its a keeper
customer_reviews.text: I use this a lot for my work travels, I typically take my food with me instead of eating in restaurants and fast food. I also purchased the AC/DC converter. I've had this plugged in for a week at a time in my room as well as traveling to and from home and everything has stayed cool. Well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Dooley

customer_reviews.title: Good for the two weeks
customer_reviews.text: Not for every day use. After i unplugged unit fan seized and unit stop working.
customer_reviews.author: Maurice

customer_reviews.title: Not getting  very cold
customer_reviews.text: Doing ok so far. Not cooling as much as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Farrell

customer_reviews.title: Does not work.
customer_reviews.text: It lasted 3 months of part time use. Thinking it was the power cord , just ordered and received. The unit is useless unless I just use as a picnic cooler with ice packs. The unit, fan does not work or even come on.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Just right size and does the job of keeping things cold
customer_reviews.text: We use this on every road trip and love it. Everything stays cold all during the drive, and because we stay in hotels we just plug it into an outlet overnight and the temp stays consistent. (We did have to buy a separate converter for plugging into an outlet as the one that came with it plugs into a cigarette lighter).
customer_reviews.author: BJMM

customer_reviews.title: Nice for  those who have  PGE for electricity
customer_reviews.text: Plug overheats if left plugged in. Run until cold then unplug it. I keep 3 blue ice packs in it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ol' Man

customer_reviews.title: Cooler Satisfactory Replacement for Buying Ice
customer_reviews.text: Cooler is perfect size to place on passenger floor of car. It is quite roomy and kept foods relatively cool traveling three days in my car. Only reason I am rating a 4 rather than a 5: milk didn't fare as well, but possibly this was the result of my disconnecting the cooler from my car overnight, as I was concerned the battery may go dead if it continued to operate when the car was not running. Also, adapter for pre-cooling in wall outlet should be included with cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Love this cooler!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product! The cooling system works extremely well and quietly! It's very easy to use and keeps the food and drinks very cool! Make sure you pre-cool your food and drinks as directed and follow all instructions. I work at a pool during the summer and before getting this, had to constantly deal with melting ice in a smaller cooler that didn't hold much. This cooler can hold quite a bit! I wish I had bought this last year! I fully recommend this product along with an A/C adapter. ..well worth the cost!
customer_reviews.author: John Larande Pycior

customer_reviews.title: This cooler worked great.
customer_reviews.text: This cooler worked constantly for 6 weeks on a recent trip. 8 days were in the car, and the rest were for a long visit with family using the adapter. I was able to keep soda and other things cold without taking up room in my Mom's refrigerator. Everything stayed nicely chilled without having the mess of ice, and things becoming soggy.
customer_reviews.author: Womanhead

customer_reviews.title: Solid Ice-less Cooler- love it.
customer_reviews.text: Great portable cooler. One thing I read from people commenting on their experiences with it was that it has an automatic shut off, so wouldn't drain your battery, that is not correct. The unit doesn't have an automatic shut off, it was their car that had the automatic shut off. So if your car does not have that, it could run your battery down depending upon how long it's plugged in. Other than that, this works great!
customer_reviews.author: Tim Halverson

customer_reviews.title: Power cord gets hot, requesting replacement power cord
customer_reviews.text: Power cord gets so hot, it melted the plastic insulater on receptacle into cigarette lighter end.
customer_reviews.author: mgr1604

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I just got a bad one, but left it plugged in and running ...
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I just got a bad one, but left it plugged in and running over night, put 8 ice cold sodas in it the next morning. It was running the whole time, but the sodas were room temperature in a few hours. Needless to say, we are returning it. Amazon has a very easy return policy which is one reason I shop with them. If you buy this, I wish you much better luck than I had.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I hoped...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a cooler that could both plug into the car and hotel at night to keep food cold on a long road trip. I did have to buy an adaptor to plug into the hotel. (I recommend the Wagan 5 Amp AC to 12V DC Power Adapter. The adaptor I bought at Radio Shack di dnot work and needs returned.) The cooler worked exactly as promised. I did not have any problems whatsoever. Do, as recommended by many others, and plug your cooler in to cool 12-24 hours before you leave on your trip. You do and it will serve you well!
customer_reviews.author: KatieB

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase, I've used this for several months
customer_reviews.text: Great Purchase, I've used this for several months. It has allowed me to keep my food and drinks cold at work. Takes very little space under my desk and cannot be heard unless your right next to it. I would buy again, recommended to several people in my office and they are glad to have purchased it as well.
customer_reviews.author: rhearhea

customer_reviews.title: Cheap product
customer_reviews.text: Soon as i received this cooler I opened up lid and it fell apart. The hinge is just a tiny plastic piece that fits into a hole and the plastic was bent would not hold the hinge lid just falls off. Not happy with this cooler at all. Also the power cable fits into lid so you cant use handle while its plugged it wont pass by the power cord.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Little

customer_reviews.title: Lid is heavy due to cooling unit, this causes ...
customer_reviews.text: Lid is heavy due to cooling unit, this causes it to lose balance when free standing with lid open when you're trying to load it. Get colder than outside, but it's not going to chill anything for you, must put already chilled food/drinks in it to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: Steve T.

customer_reviews.title: This cooler worked great and did exactly what we needed it to do
customer_reviews.text: This cooler worked great and did exactly what we needed it to do. However, now that's it been less than 6 months the plug that goes into the power supply in the dash is coming apart. The piece that makes contact keeps falling out of the plug. Without being able to plug it in and have it cool it is a very expensive ice chest.
customer_reviews.author: s thurber

customer_reviews.title: So nice to travel and not have to throw away food
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. So nice to travel and not have to throw away food. Took it into our hotel room and saved 25.00 a night from renting one from the hotel. Kept my medication at perfect temp. My daughter uses it for her baby formula. We found adding a Baggie of ice really kept temp perfect for formula.
customer_reviews.author: St. Pat

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, as not for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: I impressed with how light it was. However, I was disappointed that it is recommended to have it running 3/hrs prior to putting food in. And that nothing could cover the top vents. Both of these points were in the manual, but not in the description of the product. Too bad... I was really looking forward to having it in our car.
customer_reviews.author: cvdv

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Yet to use under emergency conditions but meets its billing.
customer_reviews.author: H. Stegall

customer_reviews.title: Great to have on the road traveling
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic for road trips. NEED to invest in adaptor to keep raining and cold in hotels at night.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl L

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job keeping food cold but it needs a good power supply if you run it overnight in a room. The power supply will get hot if the cooler is left running for hours at a time so I use a electrical timer to turn it off or on every hour. It is big enough for a week long trip if you eat out occasionally.
customer_reviews.author: RFL

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: We like our new cooler. There's more storage space inside than what we thought and we are surprised the motor is not loud. You do have to cool 3 hours BEFORE using it so it's best to buy a power adapter when ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Norman Harris

customer_reviews.title: The cooler itself may be fine, but I will never know
customer_reviews.text: I have always trusted the name Igloo and Igloo products, but they hit a glitch with this one. The cooler itself may be fine, but I will never know. After having it run in my vehicle for less than 45 minutes, the plug was very warm to the touch, and the center contact on the plug was hot enough to burn my finger. Obviously, there is way too much electrical resistance in the plug. I don't know what the odds are of starting a fire, but I am not willing to take the chance. It is going back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: JERRY W JANSA

customer_reviews.title: Cools perfectly. Just what we needed for travel. ...
customer_reviews.text: Cools perfectly. Just what we needed for travel. The only thing keeping me from giving this five stars is that the end that plugs into the cigarette lighter in the car came apart after about 5 months. We had to order a new cord. We are hoping that the new one outlasts the one that came with the cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Linda B.

customer_reviews.title: doesn't get super ice cold and if you're on a road trip ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well, doesn't get super ice cold and if you're on a road trip you can't leave it plugged in and on for too long in the car or you could have a dead battery so I usually add some ice or cold-packs to it for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: J.M.

customer_reviews.title: noise would be one of the concerns if you use ...
customer_reviews.text: noise would be one of the concerns if you use this inside of your car. Also remember it just keeps the inside temp thirty something degree below outside temp, so it is not using cooling system, just a fan and initially it has to be on for at least 3 hours to see the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Sousis

customer_reviews.title: No more soggy food.  Who needs ice!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Wish it had a little bit more energy efficient motor on it so our solar charger could keep it running longer. It is a great thing to have while camping in the desert. Precooling the air with a chillit put above the air intake rolled up into a tube really helps to drop the temperature another 15 to 20 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: MexIKen516

customer_reviews.title: Works great for a while
customer_reviews.text: Works great for a while. Then ice accumulates on the heat sink elements inside the cooler and blocks the circulation of air and temp starts to rise and the efficiency goes down the tube.
customer_reviews.author: LRS

customer_reviews.title: ... on a 3000 mile road trip and its worked great! I think the trick (as mentioned in other ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used this cooler on a 3000 mile road trip and its worked great! I think the trick (as mentioned in other reviews and booklet) is to pre-chill your items. I also froze water bottles to keep in the cooler with my items and it worked out well. The cord and charger hasn't been an issue for me but I've only had it plugged in for no longer than 12 hours at a time.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: My husband has found this cooler to be very useful. He is a truck driver and is now able to keep his food cold all day. He adds 3 small frozen water bottles to the cooler in the morning and that helps to keep everything cold. The bottles are still frozen at the end of a long day.
customer_reviews.author: sumaka

customer_reviews.title: designer
customer_reviews.text: It is big and so far so good My husband is a truck driver. Cord is good length. I haven't heard any peep out of him. The only thing this Igloo has enough room to fit a tier shelf, everything sits at bottom. Like two indentations or bumps in side and then a removable shelf. Many solutions to the problem but just saying.
customer_reviews.author: Iamgreen

customer_reviews.title: Cooler
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like the fact that there’s no off n on button no usb cord n no wall cord
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It arrived 4 days before I leave on my trip ...
customer_reviews.text: It arrived 4 days before I leave on my trip, and when I plugged it in, it doesn't work, extremely frustrating as I leave in two days and I now I don't have a cooler to go cross country.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Jankowski

customer_reviews.title: It's a teerifixc unit. I bought for my mother's ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a teerifixc unit. I bought for my mother's room in long term care; they don't allow refrigerators, but we wanted her to have access to juice and tea. I have to keep up with condensation on the inside, but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mibs

customer_reviews.title: Just wish I didnt waste the money on it
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says. Just wish I didnt waste the money on it. Should have looked for alternative solution, like a frig.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Design, But Weak Cooling
customer_reviews.text: I really like the top in-the-lid cooling unit location, the bigger size interior space, and the quiet operation (compared to our previous Koolatron cooler). Disappointed that the temperature drop is only 28 degrees F in my own test. Our previous Koolatron cooler produced an honest and reliable 40 degrees F temperature drop. It's unfortunate the temperature drop is so weak because it is great in every other respect.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold Hill

customer_reviews.title: This our 2nd one & the old one need a ...
customer_reviews.text: This our 2nd one & the old one need a new cord & now we have 2 of them that work .
customer_reviews.author: CAROLYN

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: The last one lasted two years running constantly in an otr truck.
customer_reviews.author: Jim thetford

customer_reviews.title: Not good for long time use.
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping that igloo was going to be a good cooler for using in the truck but after only having it for 6 months it doesn't stay cool anymore what a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Gladys L Winans

customer_reviews.title: I have used thermoelectric coolers for many years and this is one of the best yet. I have purchased another one so I ...
customer_reviews.text: This cooler worked as expected. It cools about 40deg.F. below ambient temperature. I have used thermoelectric coolers for many years and this is one of the best yet. I have purchased another one so I have a backup or if I need 2 units. Be sure that the fuse is in correctly or the plug will over heat.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Smith

customer_reviews.title: Super convenient!
customer_reviews.text: This iceless cooler is everything I was looking for. I drive a lot and this cooler is perfect for keeping my food cold all day, even in the south Florida heat. Don’t forget to unplug it when you are done at the end of the day. :D
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Cooler!
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is a great fit for my needs. I own a larger thermoelectric heater/cooler box for home use, but wanted something that was more portable for use in my car for short trips. I am very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Reneegrits In NC

customer_reviews.title: seems like it came out of its holding place and I ...
customer_reviews.text: The handle broke the first week I got the cooler .... seems like it came out of its holding place and I tried my best to insert it back but it's not going back in... but I liked the cooler so kept it ... works well
customer_reviews.author: Rizwan Tarar

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: We like the product for our travels. Went Westward and unit performed great. It does hum when plugged in and especially noticeable when plugged in to AC outlet. We just put it in another room to remain cool for the next day's travel. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: Buck-4-Life

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, weak plastic handle
customer_reviews.text: Swiveling handle broke in the middle. Handle also came off the side of the cooler, exposing a very weak snap-on type of connection. Cheap, weak plastic. Clearly the handle is weak. The cooling compartment/vent extends into the storage area, thus reducing the space available inside the cooler.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: We love it. Has very comfortable top handle and nice ...
customer_reviews.text: Just took a 2 week trip, using Igloo Cooler during 5 days on the road and it worked very well. We have a AC converter from a previous thermoelectric cooler (which finally died) and that worked well when taking cooler into motel rooms. Ran continuously for about 5 days and again for about 3 days. We love it. Has very comfortable top handle and nice insets on each end to pick it up also.
customer_reviews.author: YogicFlyer

customer_reviews.title: cord get to hot already needs replaced
customer_reviews.text: Love the cooler however the cord has already cracked because it got to hot the plastic cracked on the tip.
customer_reviews.author: Frances M.

customer_reviews.title: Very cool
customer_reviews.text: Keeps things very cool, not quite freezing but probably about 40degs. Kept it plugged in while car was off and ran fine. Continued to keep contents cool the whole day. It's a powerful well-made unit. Has a sturdy rubber covered handle.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Carlson

customer_reviews.title: I love it. Sometimes it gets too cold and I ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a truck driver over the road... This cooler works as promised. I love it. Sometimes it gets too cold and I have to pull the plug for a couple hours. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I use this cooler out in the oilfield inside of a pickup works great
customer_reviews.author: BigFella

customer_reviews.title: Worked Perfectly on our Ten Day Road Trip
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly on our ten day road trip. Only thing that could make it better is if it had wheels for getting in and out of the car to picnic area or hotel room. The accessory for plugging in to regular outlet when inside is a must.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Williams

customer_reviews.title: A well constructed portable cooler that gets food cold to ...
customer_reviews.text: A well constructed portable cooler that gets food cold to about 25 degrees below ambient temperature. The fan is not as quiet as the Igloo claims. It is noticeable when the car is in idle or the engine turned off. Compared it to the Koolration P20 model, (which I'm replacing) the Igloo was louder. I took one star away because of the unsupported quiet motor claim.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Treasure

customer_reviews.title: Used this on an 1800 mile drive. Not having ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this on an 1800 mile drive. Not having to purchase ice saved money. Not having to dump water or throw out food...priceless!
customer_reviews.author: E. Murry

product_meta.title: Igloo Iceless Thermoelectric Cooler
product_meta.description: The Igloo Iceless 26 quart is the ultimate solution for keeping your food and beverages cool for a long time. Cool on-the-go without the mess and inconvenience of ice in your car, SUV, RV or big rig. Iceless cooling performance is powered by thermoelectric technology. This cooler cools down to 36 degrees Fahrenheit below the outside temperature. It plugs directly into any 12V DC outlet (cigarette lighter) for easy power while traveling. It features a brushless motor and convection cooling so everything stays cold, not just some of the items. Comfortable molded hands for two handed carrying and lifting.
feature_bullets: Molded-in side handles for two handed carrying or lifting
8' long power cord plugs into any 12V DC receptacle (e.g. cigarette lighter) for portable use - good universal fit in 12V outlets
